channel.title: I dont understand this
channel.description:
hello there! Okey so i just downloaded a blank soruce and client to do some testing on before i move on to more hq servers.
I have portforwarded, through my router and through utorrent, But still i'm not able to log in to my server.. would be so happy if someone could help me out.. thanks -Max

item.title: I dont understand this
item.dc:creator: @GeneralMaxz GeneralMaxz
item.description:
@GeneralMaxz wrote:

nolan2131:

43594 is the most common, also connecting to local host privately wouldn’t require portforwarding, and I wouldn’t suggest utorrent.

can you help me on tv? please.

also, if i try to connect to 127.0.0.1 with port 43594 i can’t connect, but with port 5555 i can, help?

Read full topic

item.title: I dont understand this
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

43594 is the most common, also connecting to local host privately wouldn’t require portforwarding, and I wouldn’t suggest utorrent.

item.title: I dont understand this
item.dc:creator: @GeneralMaxz GeneralMaxz
item.description:
@GeneralMaxz wrote:

[quote=“nolan2131, post:2, topic:534777”]It’s probably connecting to another IP, you’ll need to find it server sided > client.java, and change it to 127.0.0.1 for local host, and then change it to your no-ip address when you want to host it.

Assuming this is a 317. If otherwise the IP will be located elsewhere.[/quote]
I have done that, cant connect.
what port should i use with 127.0.0.1?

Read full topic

item.title: I dont understand this
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

It’s probably connecting to another IP, you’ll need to find it server sided > client.java, and change it to 127.0.0.1 for local host, and then change it to your no-ip address when you want to host it.

Assuming this is a 317. If otherwise the IP will be located elsewhere.

Read full topic
